hello: Hello and welcome to this i18n example site!
subline: You can read some of my cool articles I wrote!

codeOfConduct.disclaimer: Animers reserve the right to modify and/or update this policy at any time in their sole discretion and without prior notice.

introduction.content: Animers is a public community in the form of offline & online events, forums, online chats, and anything else that comes up where we all interact with each other. Everyone is welcome to participate here regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, appearance, age, or anything else that makes up a person. Not only is everyone welcome, but we also want everyone to feel comfortable and feel safe.

Everyone who participates in an Animers platform (online and offline) must adhere to the following Code of Conduct. Organizers monitor members’ comments and behavior, and those who violate the code of conduct may be asked to leave the group.

subsections.content: Some content at Animers may not be suitable for children & teenagers. In addition, events are often held at locations serving alcohol. Therefore, members must be at least 20 years or older.
Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment include:

listItems.content: Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
Respect anyone's taste in Anime, Manga, Video Games, etc.

subsections.content: Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

listItems.content: Sexual language and imagery in any event venue, including online chat
Promoting your own business or service
Contact directly any of the members of the community and promote your business or service
Wearing inappropriate clothing (determined by the sole discretion of Animers).
Violent threats or language directed against another person

copyrightContent: Animers © 2020. Built by Karl Bruder & Mipon

questions.question: When's the next event?
questions.answer: The next event is on MM/DD at TT:TT

questions.question: Where is the next event being held?
questions.answer: The next event will be held at @@@

questions.question: How do I register for events?
questions.answer: You can sign up on our Meetup page: www.aaa.com

questions.question: I can't speak Japanese/English. Can I still join?
questions.answer: Sure! Many members can speak both, so you'll be able to enjoy the event.

questions.question: Can I show up without registering?
questions.answer: Sorry, but please register in advance, as there is limited space.

questions.question: Is this event exclusive to Tokyo residents?
questions.answer: No. Anyone is free to join.

questions.question: Are you holding events during the pandemic?
questions.answer: Not currently, but we are planning safe, outdoor events. Stay tuned!

questions.question: How many people do you allow at events?
questions.answer: Right now, we limit events to 8 people.

questions.question: I don't drink alcohol. Can I still join?
questions.answer: Sure! The all-you-can-drink service is optional.

questions.question: Do I have to pay full price if I don't drink alcohol?
questions.answer: No, we will deduct @@@ yen from your admission price.

advantages.title: People that work in the anime industry usually come to the event
Practice your English and/or Japanese skills
Everyone in the Community is Very Welcoming

about.title: About Animers
about.description: Animers is a bi-monthly, bilingual (English & Japanese) event for anime & manga fans in Tokyo. Our creed is to create community where everyone can have a sense of belonging and respected.

creed.title: Animers Creed
creed.description: A community where everyone can have a sense of belonging and respected.
